normalised: Someone asked me about cancer treatment options in India, so thought I would share some insights. My nani was diagnosed with stage three breast cancer last year. Initially, we were super confused about where to go. Finally, we consulted Doctor Rajesh at Tata Memorial Hospital, Mumbai. He suggested a combination of chemo and radiation therapy. The whole process was quite grueling, but thankfully, she is doing much better now. It cost us around rupee five hundred thousand for the initial treatment phase, excluding meds.

unnormalised: Besides Tata Memorial, AIIMS Delhi also has a renowned oncology department. I've heard good things about their research and patient care. Also, for advanced treatments like immunotherapy, some private hospitals like Apollo and Fortis offer them, but be prepared for higher costs, maybe around Rs. 10 lakh or more depending on the case. Remember to always get a second opinion.

unnormalised: Ultimately, it's crucial to consult with experienced oncologists to determine the best course of action. Each case is unique, and what worked for my nani might not be the right approach for someone else. Don't hesitate to explore all available resources and support groups. There's a lot of info online, but always verify it with a medical professional. Good luck and stay strong!
